alert.note: Alert for Catahoula (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 5:42PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Catahoula Parish through 630 PM CDT... At 541 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Ophelia National Wildlife Refuge, or 7 miles southwest of Larto. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Larto. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Lake Larto, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Boats could be damaged or overturned in high winds and suddenly higher waves. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
